definition: lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: And inevitably among so many boys there were low types too, snakes mixed up with dragons.
sentences.chinese: 未免人多了，就有龙蛇混杂，下流人物在内。

definition: lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk

the Three Religions (Daoism, Confucianism, Buddhism) and Nine Schools (Confucians, Daoists, Yin-Yang, Legalists, Logicians, Mohists, Political Strategists, Eclectics, Agriculturists)/fig. people from all trades (often derog.)
lit. hidden dragon, crouching tiger (idiom)/fig. talented individuals in hiding/concealed talent
as many as the hair of the ox (idiom)/great amount of/countless
money squandering establishment (e.g. gambling den, brothel etc)
dark road/criminal ways/the underworld/see also 白道[bai2 dao4]
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain/also written 渾水摸魚|浑水摸鱼
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)

pinyin: chi1 ren2 bu4 tu3 gu3 tou2

definition: mixed in as part of a community/hiding one's identity/occupying a position while not deserving it
